definitions.definition: Something said or done as a matter of form .
A customary ritual without substance, real consequence, or unique meaning .
examples: The examination for priesthood is no mere formality , so we have to study well.

definitions.definition: A specific requirement for obtaining a legal status , conducting a transaction , etc.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The state of being formal .
secondary_definitions: Something said or done as a matter of form .
A customary ritual without substance, real consequence, or unique meaning .
( countable ) A specific requirement for obtaining a legal status , conducting a transaction , etc.
